It must be the point changes throwing people off about never seeing this kind of vol before.  We're just now at +/-1%+ over the last 50 days on the S&P.  During the Financial Crisis we were AVERAGING a daily move of +/-4% over a 50-trading day period!
Any decline of more than 1.57% today for the S&P 500 would be the worst start to April since 1932.  Worst start to April was in 1929 when the index fell 2.55% on 4/1/29.
